text:
There is a possibility to create a single file fileset with a "file" attribute.
It doesn't seem to apply when it's targeted to a directory though. Now I have to
retrieve basename and parent directory of the directory and apply them though
"dir" attribute in order to proceed successfully.

I've tested this with touch task that won't accept dirset.
creator: tuomas.kiviaho@iki.fi
mbenson@apache.org
text:
What do you want to do?  Select everything below a certain directory?  <fileset
dir="${whatever}" /> Touch directories?  In Ant 1.7 you should be able to pass
dirsets (or any other ResourceCollection) to the <touch> task.  Does this answer
your question?

Ant version is the current release. It's good to know that dirset is being 
incorporated to touch and hopefully to other tasks as well. 

  <touch datetime="09/10/1974 4:30 pm">
    <fileset dir="src_dir"/>
  </touch>

changes the modification time of all files and directories found in src_dir 
and what I was after was touching only the src_dir itself.
creator: tuomas.kiviaho@iki.fi
